Crockpot Chicken Tacos

Jump to Recipe

Looking for a simple yet delicious meal that the whole family will love? Look no further than these mouthwatering Crockpot Chicken Tacos! This easy-to-follow recipe combines tender, shredded chicken with zesty taco seasoning and tangy salsa, allowing the flavors to meld beautifully throughout the day as they cook to perfection in your slow cooker. Perfect for busy weeknights or weekend gatherings, this dish is not only a crowd-pleaser but also incredibly versatile. You can customize your tacos with an array of toppings like shredded cheese, fresh lettuce, diced tomatoes, and creamy sour cream, making each bite uniquely yours. Plus, with minimal prep time and the convenience of a crockpot, you can set it and forget it, freeing you up to enjoy time with family and friends. Whether you're a seasoned cook or a kitchen novice, these Crockpot Chicken Tacos will elevate your dinner game effortlessly!

Ingredients

boneless skinless chicken breasts

Choose high-quality chicken breasts for the best flavor and texture. If you want to save time, you can use rotisserie chicken instead, simply shred it and mix it with the sauce after cooking. For a healthier option, consider using chicken thighs instead, as they stay juicier.

taco seasoning

You can make your own taco seasoning by mixing chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and salt. This allows you to adjust the spice level to your preference. If you're looking for a lower sodium option, opt for a salt-free taco seasoning or make your own.

salsa

Use your favorite store-bought salsa for convenience, but for a fresher taste, consider making your own with fresh tomatoes, onions, cilantro, and lime juice. You can also experiment with different types of salsa, such as mango or corn salsa, to add a unique twist.

tortillas

Corn tortillas are traditional for tacos, providing a nice texture and flavor. If you prefer flour tortillas, they are softer and easier to fold. Consider warming them up on a skillet before serving to enhance their flavor and pliability.

shredded cheese (optional)

Use a cheese blend like Mexican blend or Monterey Jack for a classic flavor. If you're looking for a healthier option, try using reduced-fat cheese. For a unique flavor, consider adding crumbled queso fresco or even a sprinkle of feta.

lettuce (optional)

Romaine or iceberg lettuce is great for tacos, giving a crunchy texture. You can also use shredded cabbage for added crunch and a slight sweetness. If you want to enhance the flavor, consider adding a squeeze of lime juice to the lettuce.

diced tomatoes (optional)

Fresh diced tomatoes add brightness to the tacos. You can also use canned diced tomatoes (drained) for convenience. For a twist, consider adding cherry tomatoes or using roasted tomatoes for a deeper flavor profile.

sour cream (optional)

Sour cream adds creaminess and tang. For a lighter option, use Greek yogurt instead, which also adds protein. You can enhance the flavor by mixing in some lime juice or fresh herbs like cilantro.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Chicken

    Begin by placing the 2 lbs of boneless skinless chicken breasts in the bottom of your crockpot. Make sure the chicken is arranged in a single layer for even cooking.

  • Step 2: Add Taco Seasoning

    Sprinkle the entire packet of taco seasoning (1 oz) evenly over the chicken. This will infuse the chicken with delicious flavor as it cooks.

  • Step 3: Pour in the Salsa

    Pour 1 cup of salsa over the seasoned chicken, ensuring that the chicken is well-coated. This not only adds flavor but also helps keep the chicken moist during cooking.

  • Step 4: Set Cooking Time

    Cover the crockpot with its lid and set it to cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 3-4 hours. Cooking on low is recommended for the best texture and flavor.

  • Step 5: Shred the Chicken

    Once the cooking time is up, use two forks to shred the chicken directly in the crockpot. The chicken should be tender and fall apart easily.

  • Step 6: Assemble the Tacos

    Warm 8 tortillas as per package instructions. Serve the shredded chicken in the tortillas and top with optional ingredients like 1 cup shredded cheese, 1 cup lettuce, 1 cup diced tomatoes, and 1 cup sour cream.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare chicken breasts for cooking?

Start by rinsing the chicken breasts under cold water and patting them dry with a paper towel. If there's excess fat or any visible sinew, trim it off with a sharp knife.

What is taco seasoning and how do I use it?

Taco seasoning is a blend of spices typically including chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, and paprika. For this recipe, simply sprinkle the packet evenly over the chicken for flavor.

How do I know when the chicken is cooked through?

The chicken should reach an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C). You can use a meat thermometer to check, or cut into the chicken; it should be white and juices should run clear.

What if I don't have a crockpot? Can I still make this recipe?

Yes! You can use a stovetop or oven. For stovetop, simmer on low heat for about 1-1.5 hours, or bake in a covered dish at 375°F (190°C) for about 45-60 minutes.

How can I safely shred the chicken?

Once the chicken is cooked, use two forks to pull it apart while it's still in the crockpot. Be cautious if the chicken is very hot; you can let it cool slightly before shredding.

What toppings can I use for my tacos?

You can use a variety of toppings like shredded cheese, lettuce, diced tomatoes, sour cream, avocado, or hot sauce. Choose your favorites to personalize your tacos!

How do I warm tortillas?

You can warm tortillas in a skillet over medium heat for about 30 seconds on each side, or wrap them in foil and place them in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for 10-15 minutes.

Are there any tips for cooking chicken in a crockpot?

Avoid overcrowding the crockpot; it cooks best with a single layer of meat. Also, don't remove the lid during cooking, as this lets heat escape and can extend cooking time.

How can I store leftovers safely?

Let the chicken cool completely before transferring to an airtight container. Store in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

Can I customize the salsa?

Absolutely! You can use store-bought salsa or make your own with diced tomatoes, onions, cilantro, lime juice, and jalapeños for a fresh taste.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For gluten-free guests, use corn tortillas instead of traditional flour tortillas. To make the dish healthier, consider using low-fat cheese or Greek yogurt in place of sour cream. For a vegetarian version, substitute the chicken with jackfruit or lentils seasoned with the same taco spices and salsa.

Pairings

Pair these Crockpot Chicken Tacos with a refreshing side of Mexican street corn (elote) or a simple avocado salad to balance the flavors. For beverages, consider serving with a chilled margarita, a light Mexican lager, or a non-alcoholic hibiscus tea (agua de jamaica) for a vibrant pairing.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Crockpot Chicken Tacos on a large platter, allowing guests to build their own tacos with various toppings. Set up a taco bar with bowls of shredded cheese, lettuce, diced tomatoes, sour cream, and hot sauce for customization. Consider garnishing with fresh cilantro and lime wedges for added freshness. To enhance presentation, serve on colorful plates or napkins that reflect a festive atmosphere.

#

Crockpot Chicken Tacos

490 min
$10
250 kcal
Difficulty: 10%
Servings: 8

Dietary Tags:

Gluten-FreeLow-Carb

Cuisine:

Mexican

Course:

Main Course

Tags:

EasyQuickHealthyComfort Food

Description

Tender shredded chicken simmered in zesty taco seasoning, perfect for easy tacos any day!

Ingredients

  • boneless skinless chicken breasts: 2 lbs
  • taco seasoning: 1 packet (1 oz)
  • salsa: 1 cup
  • tortillas: 8
  • shredded cheese (optional): 1 cup
  • lettuce (optional): 1 cup
  • diced tomatoes (optional): 1 cup
  • sour cream (optional): 1 cup
